alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Harnett; Hoke; Johnston; Sampson; Scotland; Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 4:40PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Scotland, central Wayne, Sampson, southeastern Harnett, Cumberland, southern Johnston and southern Hoke Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 439 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Benson to 11 miles east of Fayetteville to near Antioch. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Goldsboro, Smithfield, Clinton, Raeford, Dunn, Mount Olive, Benson, Fremont and Godwin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cumberland; Harnett; Hoke; Johnston; Sampson; Scotland; Wayne
